We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.)&nbsp;High Voltage Electrical Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Igbesa, Ogun&nbsp;
Reporting To: Maintenance Supervisor / Electrical Engineering Manager
Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Responsibilities


	Operate and maintain high voltage equipment (11kV, 33kV and above) safely.
	Perform high voltage electrical installations, troubleshooting and repairs.
	Assist in routine inspection and emergency response in substations and distribution systems.
	Ensure compliance with NEMSA and company safety regulations.
	Prepare technical reports, maintenance logs and suggest improvements.


Job Requirements
Education:


	Diploma or Degree in Electrical Engineering or related technical field


Certifications:


	Valid NEMSA High Voltage Electrician or Installer License is mandatory
	Trade Test Certificate (Grade I or II in Electrical Work) is an added advantage


Experience:


	Minimum of 3 years of hands-on experience in high voltage power systems.


Skills:


	Proficient in 33kV/11kV breakers, transformers, and protection systems
	Capable of independently troubleshooting and restoring high voltage systems


Others:


	Strong safety awareness and team spirit
	Willing to work night shifts, respond to emergencies and perform field duties.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;jonathanogbone@vijufamily.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

&nbsp;

2.)&nbsp;Generator Technician (Diesel &amp; Gas Generators)

Job Location:&nbsp;Igbesa, Ogun&nbsp;
Industry: Power Generation / Industrial Utilities
Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Summary


	We are seeking skilled and dedicated Generator Technicians to operate, maintain, service, and repair diesel and gas-powered generators at our facility in Igbesa, Ogun State.
	The ideal candidates will have hands-on experience with large industrial generator systems and be able to work independently with minimal supervision.


Key Responsibilities


	Operate diesel and gas generators in accordance with standard operating procedures
	Perform routine maintenance and scheduled servicing (oil changes, filter replacements, etc.)
	Diagnose and repair faults in engine, alternator, control panels, fuel systems, and cooling systems
	Monitor generator performance and carry out regular inspections
	Maintain accurate logs of operation, faults, and maintenance activities
	Ensure compliance with safety and environmental standards
	Respond to emergency breakdowns and carry out corrective actions promptly


Requirements


	Proven experience (3+ years) in generator operations and maintenance
	Strong knowledge of diesel and gas engine systems
	Ability to troubleshoot mechanical and electrical issues
	Familiar with control systems (manual and automatic start/stop, load transfer panels)
	Technical certification in mechanical, electrical, or power engineering preferred
	Must be reliable, responsible, and able to work independently
	Residence in or willingness to relocate to Igbesa, Ogun State


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;jonathanogbone@vijufamily.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Quality, Health, Safety, and Environment (QHSE) Manager Job at Nestoil Plc




        
    

        
        Nestoil Plc was incorporated in Nigeria in 1991 for the provision of Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) services to the energy and oil & gas industry. Since then, Nestoil has grown to become the leading indigenous EPC provider for major IOCs (International Oil Companies) in Sub-Saharan Africa like National Petroleum Company (NNPC) Shell, Exxon Mobil, Chevron, Total, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality, Health, Safety, and Environment (QHSE) Manager

Job Location: Warri, Delta
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are on an evolutionary journey where we’re changing our story. We are looking to hire an experienced QHSE Manager to join our diverse team in our Company.
	In this role, you will oversee and manage all aspects of the business’ QHSE programs. This includes developing, implementing, and maintaining policies, procedures, and guidelines to ensure compliance with relevant standards and regulations.
	The role also involves conducting risk assessments, audits, and investigations, as well as promoting a culture of safety and quality throughout the business.


As a QHSE Manager, You Will Be Responsible For


	Maintaining records/registers of injuries and illnesses occurred, and treatment given by the base & field locations Medic. 
	Presenting all personnel on board with safety induction training and instructing inductees on hazards relevant to their positions. 
	Conducting regular hygiene inspections on SDI office, base and field locations. 
	Maintaining emergency medical equipment in prepared state of readiness and maintaining an accurate inventory of same. 
	Participating in and contributing to the objectives described in the MODU’s annual plan.
	Providing safety training to employees and assisting Operations & Base Manager with hazard identification, accident prevention and recognition. 
	Advising Operations & Base Manager on safety administration and safety inspections.
	Maintaining an accurate inventory of safety and lifesaving equipment in the office, base and field locations and instructing all personnel on its use.
	Ensuring that all Lifesaving Appliances such as fire extinguishers, lifeboat inventories etc. are carried out as per the maintenance program. 
	Assisting in the implementation of safety policies and procedures in accordance with local, state, federal, maritime and company regulations and monitor effectiveness. 
	Ordering and obtaining training materials and maintain a record of all training activities.
	Undertaking audits and inspections in line with the company’s audit and inspection procedures.
	Being the Custodian of national and international regulatory and compliances protocols, certifications and registrations. 
	Maintaining an up-to-date HSE and Quality Management system. 
	Coordinating and managing emergency preparedness. 
	Participating in and monitoring all safety initiatives and safety programs. 
	Participating in and monitoring all safety meetings, including weekly, pretour and pre-job/toolbox meetings. 
	Monitoring personnel and equipment for compliance with statutory requirements and the company’s policies and procedures. 
	Participating in discipline and counselling procedures relating to issues concerning safety
	Preparing and sending reports to the Line Manager on the implementation of safety programs
	Maintaining accurate personnel and training records 
	Implementing the hazard communication program 
	Overseeing the activities and duties of all Mechanics on the base and field locations.
	Performing other duties as assigned by Line Manager


What Are We Looking For


	Bachelor’s Degree in related Discipline 
	Minimum of 7 years of experience as a Safety Officer in the oil and gas industry – with at least 5 years on land, swamp, base and field locations.
	NEBOSH Certificate, Instructors’ qualifications or First-Aid/CPR
	Must maintain knowledge of hazardous waste policies and procedures 
	Excellent knowledge of QHSE principles and Laws
	Knowledge and understanding of the impact of failure of QHSE key systems and processes.
	Problem solving and Time management
	Coaching and Supervisory skills 
	Proficiency in the use of MS Office Suite (Word, Excel and Power Point) 
	Leadership skill

Our team brings together more than 20 years of global experience across multiple industries, including telecommunications, education, the legal sector, research, media, and technology. This wealth of expertise enables us to deliver comprehensive, innovative solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of our clients. With years of focused experience in the African edtech industry, our clients span a range of industries, reflecting our ability to deliver tailored digital solutions that meet diverse business needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Full Stack Engineer
Job Location: Remote
Employment Type: Full-time
Start Date: Immediate

Role Description


	We are seeking a technically strong and product-driven Full Stack Engineerwith can-do attitude and is able take full ownership of the development lifecycle — from development through deployment — and lead our platform to a functional and scalable MVP.
	This is a full-time remote role for a Full Stack Engineer. As a Full Stack Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining both the back-end and front-end of web applications. This includes writing code, implementing new features, troubleshooting issues, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions.
	In this role, you won’t just write code — you’ll engineer the entire product stack, drive architectural decisions, and play a pivotal role in transforming concepts into high-performing, production-ready software.
	You must be comfortable working across both front-end and back-end technologies, integrating AI services, and deploying maintainable, scalable systems. You will be expected to set up and lead all core engineering operations, manage deployments, and ensure performance, security, and usability standards are met.
	This is a high-responsibility, builder role with clear goals: ship a robust MVP, iterate fast based on user feedback, and lay a solid foundation for scale.


What You’ll Do


	Take end-to-end ownership of the new platform — backend infrastructure to frontend UI.
	Architect, develop, and deploy new features, including AI-powered scoring tools.
	Maintain and enhance the current codebase (dashboards, admin tools).
	Integrate external APIs and third-party services (e.g. OpenAI, ATS, payment systems).
	Optimize the system for scalability, performance, and security.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams including founders, designers, and early customers.
	Manage version control, DevOps pipelines, and deployment environments.

	Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field
	Back-End Web Development and Software Development skills
	Front-End Development and Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) skills
	Experience in Full-Stack Development wth high proficiency in Laravel Framework, PHP, and Vue JS
	Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
	Effective communication and collaboration abilities
	Ability to work independently and remotely

	Passionate about building impactful products that empower professionals.


Salary

Data Analyst, Reconciliation & Payments Job at Moove




        
    

        
        Moove is on a mission to redefine what large-scale rideshare leasing and vehicle ownership look like in Africa. We are developing an innovative model to rapidly improve the availability of vehicles for on-demand ridesharing services across major metro cities while also creating sustainable jobs for drivers

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst, Reconciliation & Payments

Job Location: Lagos
Department: Data

About the Role
     

            
    




	As a Data Analyst for Reconciliation & Payments, you will support Moove’s operations by performing data analysis, ensuring data quality, and providing business insights. 
	Your role will involve conducting exploratory analysis, automating recurring data requests, and supporting business and product strategies with actionable insights.


Responsibilities
What You’ll be Doing:


	Develop and maintain cross browser compatible web and mobile based applications and work closely with team to enhance existing functionalities
	Take charge and be a decision driver for assigned web platforms
	Ability to explain issues, decisions and solutions to the team succinctly
	Produce prototypes and effectively articulate design decisions
	Keep up-to-date on emerging technology solutions, particularly those on JavaScript, for continuous improvements in front-end application development and end-user experience
	Open to work in Low-code No-code tools and Backend


Who You'll Be Working with:


	Directly reporting to our Lead Data Analyst , and closely working with our Product, Data and Engineering Teams.


Requirements
What You will need for this position:


	Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics.
	Advanced SQL proficiency (cohort analysis, complex joins, window functions, etc.).
	Experience with Python for exploratory data analysis and automation
	Knowledge of reporting tools like Looker/Holistics/Quicksight.
	Experience: Proven experience in data analysis, working with business users to create reports and dashboards, and delivering actionable insights. Familiarity with statistical packages (e.g., Google Sheets, Python libraries).
	Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, critical thinking, and business acumen.
	Ability to communicate insights clearly & collaborate with cross-functional teams.
